  physical_appearance: This blue white stem cup has its exterior body painted in rich cobalt blue. This background was executed in the signature 17th century cracked ice pattern
 whose asymmetry visually contrasts against the curves of the plum blossoms. The lower rim of the stem is decorated with a jagged teeth  pattern.

  subject_terms_4: 

  context_1: The dish was exhibited in the Exhibition of Chinese Blue-and-White Ceramics exhibition held at the National Museum of Singapore in April 1978. It is featured as number 156 in the exhibition catalogue. They are featured as number 285 in the exhibition catalogue.

  sgcool_label_text: The stemcup is decorated with plum blossoms against a blue background filled with the cracked ice pattern (). The cracked-ice pattern gained popularity as a decorative motif in seventeenth-century China and was appreciated for its beautiful asymmetry. On porcelain vessels
 the pattern is often coupled with the plum blossom
 which was regarded as a symbol of strength and endurance since the flower blooms in late winter or early spring.is decora

metadata.physical_appearance: This blue white stem cup has its exterior body painted in rich cobalt blue. This background was executed in the signature 17th century cracked ice pattern, whose asymmetry visually contrasts against the curves of the plum blossoms. The lower rim of the stem is decorated with a jagged teeth  pattern.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: The stemcup is decorated with plum blossoms against a blue background filled with the cracked ice pattern (). The cracked-ice pattern gained popularity as a decorative motif in seventeenth-century China and was appreciated for its beautiful asymmetry. On porcelain vessels, the pattern is often coupled with the plum blossom, which was regarded as a symbol of strength and endurance since the flower blooms in late winter or early spring.is decora
